title: Collegiate Track and Field Data Science Insights
text: This was my final project in my data science course from Fall 2023. The project involved finding an enticing data set and making fascinating insights and visual displays. I analyzed the last 14 years of the Division III New England Region Track and Field Championships, Amherst’s Indoor championship meet. Below is my shiny app interface. See which events have been dominated by which schools, and how significant the margins of improvement are from year to year.

title: Collegiate Track and Field Data Science Insights
The History of Holyoke Parsons Paper Company
text: This was my final project in a statistics course from Spring 2022. My report analyzed an old register for the Parsons Paper Company of Holyoke, Ma in the 1860s. The register was found in an attic in Holyoke and brought to the attention of my professor, who then tasked my class with curating a report that analyzes the register in an interesting way. I spent countless hours transcribing the names on each page to form a database that I could then use R to make inferences on. My final report is below.

title: The History of Holyoke Parsons Paper Company
Portfolio
text:
Hello, I am Camden Heafitz from Marblehead, MA, a rising senior at Amherst College. I am double majoring in statistics and psychology and one of the captains of the Men’s Track and Field team. In my spare time, I am writing a psychology honors thesis about the effects of stress and caffeine on performance and persistence. In addition, I practice guitar, piano and vocals in a band on campus. My true interests lie in data science, sports, and music.
Welcome to my portfolio compiling my final projects in previous Statistics and Data Science courses at Amherst College. I am most passionate about my Track and Field project where I analyzed over 10 years worth of collegiate track and field data to give an interesting perspective on my conference’s history.
